text: ABS_CALL = indicating whether the transcript was present (P), absent (A), or marginal (M)

protocol.text: All inforescence apices were collected from shoots that had produced between 10-20 mature (post anthesis) flowers below the inflorescenece apex.  Shoots younger or older than this were not used . Inforescence apices were collected and placed immediately in 100% ice-cold ethanol, then stored in ethanol at -20 degrees C until ready for dissection. Dissections of the inflorescence apices were completed within 6 days. Carpels/gynoecia from floral stages 8-10 were pooled with 15-25 gynoecia serving as one biological replicate.
Plants were grown with long days (16 hrs) at 24 degrees C and randomized within the growth chamber.

Total RNA was extracted using the RNeasy Plant Mini Kit from Qiagen. Amplification, labeling, and fragmenting of the cDNA was carried out according to GeneChip 3' IVT Express Kit instructions from Affymetrix.
Amplification, labelling, and fragmenting of the cDNA was carried out according to GeneChip 3' IVT Express Kit instructions from Affymetrix.

The hybridization cocktail was denatured at 99°C for 5 minutes, incubated at 45°C for 5 minutes and then injected into a GeneChip cartridge which was incubated at 45°C for at least 16 hours in a rotating oven at 60 rpm.  GeneChips were washed and stained using a Fluidics station 450 using protocol: EukGE-WS2v4_450. Samples processed by Expression Analysis (Durham, NC).

Hardware: Affymetrix GC3000 scanner with 7G upgrade, Factory PMT settings. Software: AGCC version 3.1.1, CHP files were scaled using a target intensity of 500. Samples processed by Expression Analysis (Durham, NC).
The CHP files were generated in AGCC using the MAS 5.0 algorithm with a global scaling of 500. Samples were processed by Expression Analysis (Durham, NC).
